Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We could get Deangelo flowers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you can't get flowers for someone who's in a coma. They'll wilt before he wakes up.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's true.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All in favor of the baskets full of chocolates, teddy bears, and balloons? [all but Dwight raise their hands]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, wait. All in favor of the knapsack filled with canned goods, chainsaw, gasoline, and emergency radio in case he wakes up post-apocalypse? [Dwight raises his hand]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. Baskets have it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So as it turns out, unless you're a young child or a prison inmate, you don't need anyone supervising you. People just come in and do their work on their schedule. Imagine that - people like us allowed to sell paper. Unsupervised. [Darryl, Phyllis, Stanley, and Oscar are working while Andy and Ryan play on a foosball table] And yet, somehow it works. It must be because the stakes are so high.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Well, I really appreciate the offer, but I'm just happy the way things are. Okay. Thank you. [to Pam] That was Jo, asking me if I wanted to take over as acting manager while they find a replacement. I told her... I don't want to mess this up, right? There's a consensus, people are happy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] Dwight Schrute. Yes, I would. Thank you. [hangs up] Jordan, gather my things from my desk. [Dwight walks to the manager's office, rubs the door frame, sits at the desk reverently]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What have you done?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight [on phone]
Quote.Text: Mose... you'll never guess where I am right now.

Quote.Speaker: Mose [on phone]
Quote.Text: Aaaaahhhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can't stay there all day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm coming.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do I at least get to go with you in this fantasy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You'd slow me down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight has been acting manager for three months now. No. A week. Just feels like three months. Let's see, we all have to punch in to a time clock, which is very old, very strong, and has a slot about the size of a finger. [Jim puts a pencil into the time clock and pulls it out broken in half] We were all given new business cards big enough to set us apart from the competition, which is how I learned that our titles are all now Junior Employee. Our lunch breaks are staggered to prevent wasting time. Mine's at 10:30, and I find that the first hour of the day goes by a lot quicker than the second seven hours.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop stalling! Come on.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America, and to the republic for which it stands, one nation...

Quote.Speaker: All but Oscar
Quote.Text: ...under God...

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: ...indivisible, with liberty and justice for all. [Kevin finishes behind the rest of the group]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Amen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excellent. Morning announcements! There's been a problem with some people sharing copier codes. Your copier code is a distinct 21-digit number that is unique to you, and you only, okay? Don't share it. [Kevin looks exasperated] Jo Bennett, our CEO, will be here today for a high-level meeting involving Gabe and myself.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ooh, about what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's on a need-to-know basis.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I thought I needed to know for your calendar.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [quietly] General meet-and-greet. So I expect you to be on your best behavior, which means none of you will be insubordinate, nor will you foment insurrection.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Question, if we already fomented insurrection, may we be grandfathered in?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Define foment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You define foment.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Please take note of the new color-coding system.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [surprising Kelly] Aha!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, what is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gotcha! Why are you late?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's none of your business, actually. It's very medical and personal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right. You stop me when I reach the diseased area. [Dwight points to her legs and slowly moves his finger up, stopping at her mid-section]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: In fairness, Darryl did tell me that joke, so...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh! Darryl's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know, right?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Can I talk to you a second about these client memos?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure. What's going on? [in room with Gabe]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Are you still in love with Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Because I am. I need to get her back. [crying] I can't be alone anymore. Andy, do you like being alone with me right now?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, this is horrifying.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No. I don't like being alone with me either, okay? I have to get her back. Are you still gonna date her?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We're just friends, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Do you promise that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, fine, I promise. We'll never date again. Can we go outside now?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No, just give me a second. I don't want anyone to know I've been crying.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [seeing the Join the Fist flyers that Jim is hanging] Hey, hey, hey, hey. What do you think you're doing? What's this? What's the Fist?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, it's just a social club. You know, like the French Revolution, or the Black Panthers, or communism. It's just a club. Guys talking, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You expect me to believe that you're starting a rebellion?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. Social club. God, I hate when everybody calls us a rebellion. [Darryl enters and brandishes his fist, Jim returns the gesture]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? I would love to join The Fist.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And we would love to have you. But not today. Unfortunately, it's a bad day, what with Operation Overthrow and everything, but I have noted it. [Dwight tears the sign down, Jim hangs two signs in its place]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [inputting numbers into the copier and holding up the line] One...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [refills his coffee near a sign that reads "Honor System:

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pam, I have to show you this video. You're gonna love it. It's Beyonce falling with a fart mixed in. [buzzer to indicate a blocked web site]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will never be happier than I am right now. I will also never be less happy. I will be at my current maximum happiness for the rest of my life. Because I am manager of the Scranton Branch of Dunder Mifflin. Acting Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [looking at empty vending machine] No food now? Someone has to do something about Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: He put some snacks in the freezer for us.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You mean the frozen mice for the piranha?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No. The blueberry Slurpee pouch.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He means the ice pack.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [on phone] 2:00 should probably be okay. I can either take your number or - [Gabe ends the call]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. This can't wait.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's just gonna call back.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Erin, I am in love with you. I don't believe in much, okay? I don't believe in horoscopes. I don't believe in Christmas. Uh, uh, I sure as hell don't believe in God. [Erin and Angela both look taken aback]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [quietly] What?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Or maybe there's a God. I don't know. I mean, it's just not a guy with a long white beard. [Erin looks shocked] Or it could be. I mean, it's possible that that is exactly what - what God is. But for all of the disbelief [phone rings] I believe in us. I believe in love. You have made me believe that for all of the hokum [phone continues ringing] out... there... uh, do we not have voicemail?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dwight doesn't trust robots to give us our messages.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well... it's just... [ringing] it messes up my rhythm.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm taking a break from dating. Gabe was a great guy with so many wonderful qualities, but it was a challenge being touched by him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, you've really embraced the whole Bond villain aesthetic.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah, Jim, Jim, Jim. The gun is a Beaumont-Adams. Jo collects them. I thought we could have some nice small talk about it. And the piranha's a rescue.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And the desk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The desk is a replica of Uday Hussein's desk. I saw a picture in Newsweek. Listen, I'm a very busy man. Let's get right down to business.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jo is coming later today. I cannot have a subordinate trying to make me look stupid. Okay? I need you to promise me that you'll be on your best behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I promise...d other people that I would be on my worst behavior. And I gave them my word, so...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't make me fire you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You can't fire me. You're acting manager. Not office manager. So you have no firing powers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't make me pre-fire you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You wouldn't dare.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Watch this. You're pre-fired. And when I'm promoted, you'll be full fired.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [quietly] If you get promoted, and if you haven't fallen in love with me by then.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If I had thought that there was a real chance that Dwight would be permanent manager, I would have pre-quit. And you might be saying to yourself, "Well that's pretty premature to think," but I always say, it's better to be pre-pre-preprepared.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How you doing, Jordan?

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everyone here thinks that you're a joke. They think that you were hired because of your good looks, which won't last long anyway. As your pale skin and severe bone structure imply, you'll age swiftly and poorly.

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Why are you telling me this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now I want you to find out what people are saying about me, things they don't want me to know abou-[Dwight opens a box and sits down in shock] Ohh... it's a holster.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walking around the office with the holster around his waist] Yep. Yep, yep, yep. Lookin' good. [grunts] Ohh... [stretching out his arms to better indicate the gun and holster] Oh, what a day. What a day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, are you carrying a gun?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The holster was a gift from my great-uncle Honk. Um, I don't know. I guess he's saying that he's proud of me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight, guns make me really uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The gun is just an accessory to the holster, okay? I can't walk around wearing an empty holster.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why do you need to wear the holster at all?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why do you need to keep wearing those booby shirts all the time?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You could put your cell phone in it instead.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh... hello! [indicates his phone clipped onto his belt]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You could put a banana in it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why would I put a banana in my holster?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: In case you weren't hungry now, but you got hungry later.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, no gun, okay? Don't make us call Jo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. All right. Fine. Everyone calm down. Someone get me a banana. Sorry I freaked you guys out - aah! [Dwight goes to flip the gun and it fires near Andy's ear, making everyone jump]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aah! Aah! It's so loud!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: My God. There is a hardwood floor underneath this carpeting. Why would they do that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [trying to find a pitch] Eeeeeeee... There's like this crazy ringing going on. I can't - eeeeeee... I can't find perfect C.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Okay, everyone make a list of what's lost for the insurance. I lost a necklace, a ring, a painting-

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Dwight went on a shooting spree, and then he shot Andy in the head.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. All we know is that a gun fired. That's all we know! No. That's not true. Actually, we heard a loud noise. Later, a hole was seen. No one saw the bullet leave the gun.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [scatting off-key] Something's definitely wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll look on WebMD. What are your symptoms?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, everybody. Oscar found a reason to look on WebMD.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [buzzer to indicate a blocked site] Firewall.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I can't reach Jo. She must already be on the plane.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, why are you calling Jo?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think I should go the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'll go with you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No! We really shouldn't be without a receptionist. Now more than ever.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll take him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you, Darryl. [Andy limps out of his chair and leans on Darryl for support]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What's wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's my ear.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [excitedly] Oh, I should get the accident report binder. I've never used the gun violence forms before.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm gonna keep trying Jo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, everyone! Conference room, right now!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [enters with a cowboy hat, speaking with a Western accent] Yee-haw! Whoo-hoo! [imitates gunfire] Howdy, partners! It's me, Gun-Safety Dwight! And I'm the rootin'-est- [removes hat] I can't do this. Um, look. Obviously, a gun went off under my watch, and I'm launching a full investigation.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We all saw you do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? You did? What hand was I holding the gun in? What did Andy's tie look like?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Navy blue. Little red anchors.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have no way of knowing if that's true.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I am supposed to collect eyewitness accounts. Who saw Dwight do this? [all raise their hands]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, really?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Would you consider this a terrorist incident?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I felt terrorized.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, there's a whole 'nother terrorism booklet for that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I just really, really think we should handle this internally.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dwight, why is it on us to protect you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Because you guys are my best friends, and I mean that. Managing you for this last week has been the greatest honor of my life. And if you ruin this, I will burn this office to the ground. And I mean that figuratively. Not literally. Because you guys are so... so important... to me. I love you guys. But don't cross me. But you're the best.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. [Erin gasps] We're back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There he is! Our hero! [Both Dwight and Erin move to hug Andy] You look fantastic. How you doing? Here, tell us your war stories.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I burst my eardrum. Doctor said it could take weeks to heal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did they say what caused it? Because I know you like putting Q-tips deep into your ear canal.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: How's your hearing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Temporary deafness in one ear. It was both ears. I couldn't hear a thing Darryl was saying while we were in the waiting room.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I was talking like this. [mouths words while pointing to his ear] I don't feel good about it, but he just kept calling himself a gunshot victim and it got to me.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Dwight, I would like tomorrow off so that I can go on my American Idol audition.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: American Idol? What? No.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Okay. I guess I can just not go. Do you guys wanna hear my solo?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [singing] Why did my temporary boss go on a shooting spree?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, fine. You can go on your singing audition.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay, well, then I want an extra vacation day.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pet Day! I want Pet Day back - no dogs.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Put back everything in the vending machine except the fruit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I put everything back in the vending machine.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Put everything back in the vending machine except... the fruit.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You have to get rid of all your weapons. All of them. Including killer fish.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, is it my turn? Ooh, I'm on the spot. I don't know. Um... you know what? I think I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. When Jo's here, can you work in "Shagadelic, baby," at least three times in a conversation? Oh, and when I cough can you do jazz hands?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's jazz hands?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [quickly shakes his hands back and forth]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [leaves the men's room with an empty fish tank after flushing the toilet]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [after entering the men's room] What the [bleep] is that? [runs out of the bathroom] Oh, my...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Hey, all! Cornelius, Bobo, have at it. Nobody let my dogs hump each other. They don't seem to know they're brothers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello, Jo. Welcome. Well, shall we begin?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Slow yourself down there. Just like a man. Wants to jump right into it while I still got my socks on. Jim Halpert - the only man that ever turned me down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I don't know about that. Just wasn't for me. But let me assure you, Dwight is firing on all cylinders. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, some pretty big shoes to fill. I was sorry to hear about Deangelo. He was a good man. Tragic. [Jim coughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [does jazz hands, Jo notices and eyes him oddly] Well, what can you do? Life.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We have to clean this up now!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: She had so much -

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hope I'm not interrupting anything.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No! [Erin and Andy laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy, did you tell Erin about our conversation earlier when you said you would never want to date her again?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I just thought that it was so interesting that you promised that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did I say that earlier? Yes, I did. Because you, Gabe, were crying...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No, I was not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And sobbing uncontrollably. Yes. Uh-huh. You were in hysterics. And my maternal instincts kicked in. Is it actually how I feel? Yes. Or no. That is... between me and my diary.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oscar, can you print out last year's sale statements?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight, gimme a back massage.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Kevin, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: My back is sore, Dwight. Massage it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin, not now.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, Jo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Shh! [Dwight begins rubbing his shoulders]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, under the jacket.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're kidding me. [reaches under Kevin's jacket] Oh God, what am I touching? It's moist.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't feel anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, it's so wet.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Push harder, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't. I can't push harder!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Go a little higher. There you go. Nope, higher. Higher. [Dwight has positioned his feet on the filing cabinet behind Kevin and is kneading his back horizontally]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, how's that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Knead it. Knead it like a pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm kneading it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Don't eat it.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Dwight! Walk me out. Let's talk soon. And stay on top of these people. You gotta admit it - it's nice to have a little power, eh? How's it feel?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jo... I accidentally fired a gun in the office today.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am telling you this because I care too much about this job to be blackmailed into doing it poorly. All I've ever wanted was to be manager here. And if you feel that you cannot promote me over this one accident, I understand. But if you think that extortion is worse -

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Shooting is worse! Are you kidding me? It's not even in the same - you shot a gun? What is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was a Beaumont-Adams, if that helps.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Beaumont-Adams is a girl's gun. That just makes it plain stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I take full responsibility.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Who else would be responsible?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam made me put a banana in my holster.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You shot a gun off -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Did I make a mistake? Yes. Do I regret the decision that I made? Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh, stop asking yourself easy questions so you can look like a genius.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I love you, Dwight. But you don't fit this job.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the verge of tears] Jo, please... I will -

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: No, child. No. It's over. Now I gotta find a replacement for my replacement.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: You three are my search committee. You're in charge of finding me my next manager. All righty?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Till then, we need a new acting manager. Now, who's got the most experience in this office?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, well, we probably don't want to go just on seniority.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you do know that Jo was right to take the job away from you, right? There's no debating that. But, I will say... in your one week, every single one of the orders went out on time. And I think that is shagadelic, baby. [Dwight sees Creed claiming the desk in the manager's office]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [giving Kevin numbers for the copier] Four, one, seven, one...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Another one?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl and Angela
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Seven, two...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Could you turn the volume down on the beeping?
